website_summaries.verdict: With all the extras that the HiiGuy comes with, your money will go far.
pros: This model is chock full of features, including a 3 year warranty, a micro fiber cloth, a thick shoulder pad and a sturdy safety tether
A good choice if you're going to carry a heavy DSLR all day
The strap length is adjustable, too
cons: The slide mechanism to move the camera up the strap may slip out of place at times

customer_reviews.title: The strap is fine but for one major design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The strap is fine but for one major design flaw. There is a small L-shaped catch for the caribiner closure to clasp on to. Made of thin plastic. Breaking this small piece renders the whole thing useless. If this piece snaps off it cannot be safely used. See photo. If it were all metal it probably would work fine. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ng

customer_reviews.title: This thing is cool
customer_reviews.text: I love the way this thing attaches to my camera, and how long it is. It's great for quickly pulling up and shooting, and my camera rides in a comfortable spot. I bought one for my friend and he loves it too. I am uploading a video of him unboxing it, so others can see what's up.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Doggy Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best strap yet!
customer_reviews.text: After testing this strap for 2 weeks, I can now say that I am extremely pleased with this product. Every part of this thing is high quality and rugged. The pouch allows for easy battery or SD storage as well as a cleaning cloth. The strap has a huge range of adjustment for all sizes and positions. There is not a single thing I could find to complain about. If you are in the market for a camera sling strap then I would highly suggest giving this one a go.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah Fruge

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, functional, and smooth
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product! I was using the original neck strap that came with the camera and it kept interrupting my signing (I'm Deaf and use ASL). Invested in this and am so glad I did. The strap is very comfortable (even with my big boobs). The camera latch slides up easily without snagging and makes for an overall smooth and positive experience. I did get a carabineer latch as a backup to just make me feel more confident about the camera not falling. Now I'm happy and confident!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Its alright for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this but it isnt the most comfortable at first. I had to keep adjusting the darn thing until it stayed in one place. I am a small petite person so mabe bigger people wouldn't have comfort issues with it. So far it holds my camera up pretty good without me thinking it will rip from the weight of it. I am using a small sony slr if that gives an idea on weight. Not sure how it holds up on bigger dslrs like canon or nikon. Overall Ok
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that wouldn't hang/pull at my neck but felt secure so I wouldn't worry about carrying it in public places. I love this thing; admittedly i keep a hand on it while walking, because i don't want it to bump off things while i'm walking (i let my camera hang at hip height) but it's great. It extends to be pretty large so it can hang above or below the hip and gives you plenty of room to maneuver when lifting it.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: I stopped using it.
customer_reviews.text: The camera hangs down at the right length, and I like the small zipper pocket to carry an extra data card and cash, but it isn't big enough for an ID, much less a cell phone. The reason I stopped using it, though, was that the strap slides all over, so the camera is moving all over and doesn't feel secure - I now see the reason for the under-the-arm stabilizing strap.
customer_reviews.author: WordsofJoi

customer_reviews.title: These straps are as handy as shoes
customer_reviews.text: I use these straps for my cameras but I also found another use for them that has really saved my back. I put one of these straps on my canister vacuum cleaner and it has literally freed my hands to where I can totally focus on what I am doing rather than trying to work with a canister vacuum on rollers going the opposite direction. I also am able to climb up a ladder to clean with my vacuum using this strap. Very strong and easy to work with. Very high quality made and I highly recommend these, not just for your cameras, but for other applications in your world. They are really great.
customer_reviews.author: D. N.

customer_reviews.title: See photo
customer_reviews.text: Not good quality control, zipper sewn into trim making strap pocket unusable, too bad seems like a good idea for a camera strap
customer_reviews.author: Gary S.

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good product. I'm glad I got it for my ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product. I'm glad I got it for my camera, I've been shooting pictures a lot easier because of the strap and it's more comfortable. My camera doesn't hit random things or myself as much. The only drawback is if you're trying to use a tripod since you have to use the bottom but I primarily do action shots, so the tripod issue isn't a big problem. If I do need to use a tripod, I still happen to use my old strap and unscrew the strap connection from the bottom, and things work out. This strap is a great buy at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: H.C.

customer_reviews.title: My father was very happy to get this camera strap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera strap as a gift for father, that travels around the world and photography is more than a hobby. Well....it is so much better and comfortable than a standard one and in a good price. The first thing he told me is that he loves the way the straps attached to the camera so it is out of the way from his body (the old one was attached from the side of the camera). I glad I bought it! There is a shoulder pad and the straps are wide but very comfortable, feels like a quality matirial.
customer_reviews.author: DiDi

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy unless you want your cameras to break
customer_reviews.text: I am SO lucky I have great reflexes. The screws constantly detached from my camera no matter how tightly I attached them. I caught my cameras a total of 5 times in a 14 hour period. I used them for one wedding and promptly threw them in the trash. Absolute garbage product!
customer_reviews.author: Amyphotochicago

customer_reviews.title: Easy to shoot with this strap
customer_reviews.text: First off, let me be clear. I am an amateur photographer, but I love this strap! So easy to wear and adjust. I was a little apprehensive about the one connection point on tripod mount. It felt weird, at first, having the camera dangle on that one connection point. First couple of uses I would check to make sure that the screw was tight. No play in the screw and the safety tether have eased my mind. It is so easy to shoot with this strap. Just grab the camera from your hip and pull it up, frame your shot and enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this strap
customer_reviews.text: I received this strap in an expeditious manner. And the excitement was the beginning. I've been using this strap now for more than two months, and I still love and appreciate the strength of this strap and the connection to my camera. The camera is quite expensive, and having a strap to not just keep my camera steady, but the ability to wear it comfortably is a + in my business of event photography.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: I love this strap
customer_reviews.text: Great strap for larger lenses. I do a lot of hiking and wildlife photography which means It can be a challenge to take my gear with me. I primarily use a 200-500mm lense with my Nikon which has some weight so I like a nice supportive strap. I like the two attaching points, I usually keep on the body and one on the lense. The clips slide up and down the strap with ease which makes it easy to draw the camera up really fast when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Cowen

customer_reviews.title: Better that it broke while installing it rather than having ...
customer_reviews.text: The insert that you screw into the bottom of the camera is made from a very cheap alloy and snapped while installing it. It cross-threaded into my battery grip and broke with very little effort. Better that it broke while installing it rather than having it snap with a camera hanging from it, sending it to the ground and smashing it. From the other positive reviews, I expected a higher quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Akers

customer_reviews.title: I tested the strap and if fits the camera well and is comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The strap seems to be very sturdy and made of good material. The shape and the padding on the shoulder portion of the strap seems pretty good. The additional pockets for battery or SD cards on the strap are really convenient and well thought out. My only comment for improvement is to have the packaging done in a better way - maybe a cardboard box and that will make it easier to store some of the components that are not being used in it. Overall a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rojoe

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in just a few weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I like the design, and prefer slings over straps, but after only one week it was already falling apart. After only a few weeks of occasional use, all the stitching has failed, the zipper failed and it is literally falling apart. Such a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Great for having your camera ready!!
customer_reviews.text: I do photography at events. Having it at my fingertips when needed and able to hang it when not, is very useful! This has been a great tool for the work I do! I would recommend it to anyone needing their camera intermittently. It's strong yet versatile. It also has a nice swivel where it attaches to the camera. I never felt that my camera was in danger. I am extremely pleased with my purchase! LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: Trina Tuel

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I knew that I wasn't ordering anything special here. I just needed something to hold me over for a day. For the price, this is not a terrible product. But beware, if you plan to wear this all day, it could be an issue because the clamps don't hold very well which leads to creeping. I have a very nice, but expensive BlackRapid strap and I recommend them for anyone serious about photography. For anyone else, this will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: One of the best straps I've owned!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this strap for over a year now and continue to have zero complaints. The strap is very durable and worth every penny. And just recently (May 12, 2019), I lost a piece that goes to this item- screw mount. I contacted the company to see if they sold this part so I could purchase one. Instead, the company found a loose screw mount and will send it to my home. Talk about GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE! Going above an beyond!
customer_reviews.author: H. Xerxes Tzolis

customer_reviews.title: A little short
customer_reviews.text: The strap seemed a little short. The strap length in the description was total length, so it only hangs half of that.The tether strap loop has only one row of stitching,I would like two. No instructions, but it's pretty wasy to figure out. Came with an extra gizmo to screw into the camera. Nice touch, but does that n mean they expect it to fail?
customer_reviews.author: Rrr

customer_reviews.title: beware!
customer_reviews.text: this thing unscrews itself over time, so you have to constantly check it. I was on a shoot with my NIKOND850, $3K camera!! . I was in the middle of a shoot, set the camera down, thankfully I was kneeling, and it fell on my lap, I look down and caught it mid air, the silver screw part that screws into the camera unscrewed itself. I guess overtime it begins to loosen up. If I was standing, my camera would have just smashed on the floor. returning.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: This strap keeps my camera in a position that allows you to wear it comfortably sitting or standing, The package included some nice accessories. Only reason the comfort category got 4 stars is at the height adjustment buckle straps become uneven after wearing for a while. This might stop after worn a few times. Will see but overall a great sling for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Travis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to walk around with camera strapped on, no neck strain
customer_reviews.text: I like this much better than the short neck strap that came with my camera. My camera wasn't cheap (Nikon Z6) so I was a little concerned that the strap wouldn't hold it, so I did like a manual stress test pressing down with way more weight than my camera, with no problems, so I was confident latching my camera to it would be safe. Also, I'm sort of tall (6'4") and it fits fine. It also doesn't bounce around while I walking which was another thing I was concerned about.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: simple, safe, secure
customer_reviews.text: I shoot sunsets, sunrises, cityscapes, and other outdoor photography, so using the normal strap that came with the camera is too dangerous. The HiiGuy strap allows me to be hands free, while not compromising the camera. I find it very useful when I am shooting outdoor portraits in different locations as well. I often need to switch lenses, or simply be able to use both hands not wanting to put the camera down. This strap makes it possible to do both. If you shoot with more than one camera, then consider getting the double strap. (This I need when I am shooting sports or weddings).
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Best I've used
customer_reviews.text: I've always used R-Straps, however being a "fluffy" guy they didn't really fit that great. Bought this on a whim and gotta say really like it, the camera hangs low right where I want it, the quick release is a little scary - but do like the safety cable just in case. Buying two more here in next couple minutes as I shoot 250+ professional sporting events a year and always have gear hanging off me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Janes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for run and gun photography.
customer_reviews.text: This strap is perfect for run and gun photography. The camera slides along the strap, rather than being attached at two points, so you can always bring it up to shooting position without having to re-position the strap. A minor down side: because it attaches to the 1/4" thread on the bottom of the camera body, you have to remove the strap to use a tripod. It would be nice if there were a way to mount on a tripod without having to remove the strap.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jansen

customer_reviews.title: For my needs, just as good as the $50 options
customer_reviews.text: Solid camera strap strong enough for a big camera and lens. I shoot with a Nikon D750 and favor my 80-200mm lens. That's about 5 pounds of camera. I feel totally save with that load on this price conscious sling. I've had the $50 versions, and you get more padding on the strap with those. But I'm just as happy with this version and the smaller pad fits more easily into my camera bag. Very Happy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Shoulder Strap
customer_reviews.text: I really like this shoulder strap for my Olympus mirrorless camera. The strap seems very strong and has two ways to secure the camera so I have no worries about the camera becoming accidentally disconnected from the strap. It both screws into the bottom of the camera and has a safety cord as a backup. The quality of the hardware for attaching to the camera is very good. I think this is a great value for the money and does the job very well.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Rehbein

customer_reviews.title: Sits perfectly and adjusts the same
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my camera as I traveled Scotland. Setting it up was easy and it is very comfortable. The extra pockets on the shoulder pad are great to store my extra cards. I also like the safety strap for added security. Easy sliding along the strap makes getting my camera into position, easy! Very good product. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: RunesDagat

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these types of straps before and it was very high quality, easy to use or adjust and wasn't stiff or flimsy. This one was annoying to adjust and even after adjusting it seemed that it wouldn't stay. The material quality was cheap, nylon belt sure, but overall this was something I would expect to get from a dollar store. Given the price I paid, I guess you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: The bells

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camera sling to prevent sore neck from using conventional ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect camera sling to prevent sore neck from using conventional neck straps with heavy camera and lens. The camera is easy to grab when ready to shoot and hangs to the side of my hip when done with shot. All the parts are of good quality. I like the safety tether as extra security. The zippered pocket for holding extra battery & SD card is handy. Great value for sling and all the extras including the free ebook. Customer service was prompt and helpful in answering my questions and offered other tips. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lost expensive camera battery because of shoddy construction
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically to carry an extra battery in the pouch. Zipper on pouch came apart first time I just used it and I lost an expensive camera battery. Worthless and cost me a huge chunk of change for a new battery. Also can’t get the zipper back together because the basic construction is horrid.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Very useful!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought this. It makes carrying my camera less intrusive and thus more likely to happen. Only criticism (constructive) I have is the strap slides through the strap adjuster very easily. It might not look 'slick' but i have just tied off the excess right under the adjuster so it doesn't slide all the way down to the end of the strap over time. This is fine for me but might be a turn off for others.
customer_reviews.author: scaredofspiders

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good strap
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for some time now and I have never worried about it coming loose but the strap does get tangled a lot in the padding and for some reason the padding usually ends up on my back instead of staying put on my shoulder. I spend half my time adjusting it. That being said I like this much more than the regular "around your neck" straps.
customer_reviews.author: Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy but it works. As I've aged I can't carry the camera around my neck any more. Did 4 straight days of hiking in the mountains in Switzerland with this around by side and it worked fine. The only reason for 4 stars - the shoulder pad slides too easily up and down the strap and doesn't stay in place. Had to ask the hubs several times to move it back into place when it slid down my back then the strap itself is cutting into the shoulder. I will need to rig something to prevent that. Otherwise, a decent product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A pain to use
customer_reviews.text: I was actually a little disappointed. In theory it looked great. The camera attached with ease and I liked the security of the safety strap, but everything I liked about it ended there. During a short hike I had to constantly readjust the strap, because it kept slipping and going from hanging around waist to banging against my knee. I ended up using duct tape to secure it. By the end of my hike I was carrying my camera in my hand to keep it from twisting, slipping and sliding. I carry a Nikon D750, which is not a light weight camera by any means. I've since switched back to the strap that came with the my camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the standard neck strap
customer_reviews.text: I love that this keeps the camera out of the way while not in use, but I can very quickly bring it up for a shot if necessary. The clips controlling how far the camera can slide don't really stay locked that well, but it is more of an annoyance than a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: hermatia

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the neck strap that came with the Olympus camera
customer_reviews.text: I've taken the camera out on two hikes since I bought the sling. It takes a little getting use to, it does not hurt my neck and the camera is always at the ready. I also feel like the camera was secure. I like the little pouch on the sling. It fits an extra battery just fine.
customer_reviews.author: JimSki

customer_reviews.title: Not that secure
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 5 stars, but the strap has come unscrewed from my camera a couple of times. Luckily I was holding onto the camera, otherwise it would have fallen.this feels a lot more comfortable than the canon strap and distributes the weight easier. I also can’t use the strap if using a tripod or gimbal
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: Product Quality checks BEFORE shipping
customer_reviews.text: Just received this and went to test on Nikon camera. The mounting screw received on brand new strap did not fit camera. The 1/4 inch thread was cross threaded at factory and not checked for tolerance as it will not screw into the camera. Its not the camera either as camera mounts just fine on all tripods without issues. Not comfortable ordering additional mounting screws as these too may also be screwed up! Pun intended. Seems like they would check this before shipping. Guess not as others have complained about this as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more strained neck
customer_reviews.text: The strap that came with my camera was too uncomfortable on my neck. The weight of the camera tended to strain my neck. I decided to purchase this strap in hopes of alleviating this issue. I am pleased with this purchase. The over the shoulder / cross body style works great for my needs and I'm happy to report, no more strain to the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Barnes

customer_reviews.title: more confortable
customer_reviews.text: this works much better than a strap around my neck. ( have problems with my neck) the length makes it easy to use the camera while never removing the strap from my shoulder. I like the extra connector to protect from accidentally dropping the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: love it, you don't have to take you the ...
customer_reviews.text: love it, you don't have to take you the strap like others, just move the camera back and you will have it available all the time. And the pocket savesme, I always carry a memory card and that save me on a shooting training and forgot the memory card, but the pocket saves me, good idea for the pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed camera strap
customer_reviews.text: This is a sling-type strap - it attaches to the camera's tripod socket and is meant to sling over your shoulder rather than hang on your belly. An important touch is a safety link, which prevents the camera from falling if the tripod socket attachments comes loose.
customer_reviews.author: Peter G. Aitken

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy using this product and it has been serving me well even with the heavier lenses. Only thing I can say bad is that the promised 50 tips that you are supposed to get for free I can't find on their site when I put in my information for warranty purposes like they required...
customer_reviews.author: jbaxter911

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made, Comes with an extra screw in attachment for the camera base. The safety tether is a good idea. The zippered pocket on the shoulder strap will fit an extra battery, but it's a tight fit. Adjustable strap length.
customer_reviews.author: J. Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed as the strap that came with the camera was to short for me It took me a moment to figure it out but hey it was my first time I think you will love this strap its strong and holds my camera securely
customer_reviews.author: GmaReis

customer_reviews.title: screw attachement
customer_reviews.text: overall I like the strap, one thing u have to be aware of is the screw fastener on the bottom, it can unscrew after a period of time, lucky for me i keep my hands on my camera, i had to retighten the attachment after a few hours of use. i lik the comfort of the strap, just concerned with the security of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: skpaiter

customer_reviews.title: This strap offers unbelievable comfort improvements over the same old ...
customer_reviews.text: This strap offers unbelievable comfort improvements over the same old neck strap that comes with most DSLRs. My Nikon D5200 with an 18-140mm lens isn't the heaviest nor the lightest of setups, but as a traveler and hiker, the shoulder strap reduces neck pain immensely. I spilled candle wax onto the strap before a trip, so I went back to the neck strap momentarily-- never again. This strap has spoiled me and I'll never go back.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S

customer_reviews.title: So this is not horrible
customer_reviews.text: it works for holding the camera but it is pretty hard on your neck its not terrible and if you are looking for a cheap camera holder go for it but for long days at like a wedding it might be too painful
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Mikulski

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for P900
customer_reviews.text: This strap really fits the Nikon P900 well. The point of attachment fits nicely. After 2 weeks of daily use it has not loosened at all. Also the strap length fits me well, 5’8” and short waisted. The Altura strap had way too much extra strap for my body size. The Altura attachment system does not work well for the P900. I’m very happy with this Hiiguy. It’s a relief to my neck.
customer_reviews.author: WJM

customer_reviews.title: Solid connection, safe, comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great tool to add to my Nikon. It screws into the tripod opening of the camera and I have been out with it on many hobby nature shoots. The metal screw connection is sturdy, solid, strap keeps it comfortable and camera available for those quick shots. I am short bodied and this strap is good sized but adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Othermom

customer_reviews.title: Very secure. I have a Nikon P900 but believe an added heavy lens would be secure as well.
customer_reviews.text: All in all this camera strap does what it claims. I'm happy with it except there is something in the fabric that has snagged several of my tops. Can't seem to find what it is. But I do like the convenience of it. I would recommend it. I did submit the information on the warranty as instructed and have yet to receive an e-mail back from HiiGuy. It's been just about a month now.
customer_reviews.author: Luanne

customer_reviews.title: High Quality for a low price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera strap, because the one I bought at a local shop for double the price, was a small strap I didnt trust to keep my camera safe. This one is double the size of the other, so I know it will protect my camera while Im using it and this camera strap is durable and will last a long time. This one is a fraction of the cost of one I bought at a local camera store. I will keep buying my camera straps from this company, because I know I can count on them lasting a long time and very affordable!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica R.

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my missing Sony a7iii strap
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy this because I lost the original strap for my Sony a7iii camera. This is an excellent replacement. Camera strap is held in place via 1/4" bolt attachment. Happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Samus

customer_reviews.title: Good strap
customer_reviews.text: This made hiking better. Keeps my camera to the side although I did replace a clip with a conventional D ring for easy on or off between shots. It has held up. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: drunaus1

customer_reviews.title: Not secure at all
customer_reviews.text: When I connected it to my camera, I made sure it was screwed in tight but the first time I used it, it came unscrewed and my camera hit the ground. The plastic clips are useless and won't stay closed. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price, but....
customer_reviews.text: This strap is probably ok for the price, but don’t expect professional quality. If you are seriously into photography such that you need this kind of strap, consider a better brand with better hardware. It’s not really bad, but not really great either.
customer_reviews.author: ricohman

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this strap
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this strap. I used this every day for 10 day trip for hours each day. There was no neck strain like the strap that comes with the camera. It keeps the camera at your side and easily swings into action. The strap adjusts easily for my wife 5'7" and myself 6'2". I recommend this for all serous SLR camera users.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in San Diego

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but not for long time use in the sun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for when I photograph people. One thing I have noticed is the strap part where it has the pocket, if you are outside and its hot it will burn you. Overall use is good.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Roessling

customer_reviews.title: I challenge you to a duel
customer_reviews.text: I really love this camera strap. It sits comfortably near my hip and whether I have my backpack on over or under my strap I'm still able to pull it up to my face and snap away. If we were in some old western movie and we had to have a duel at high noon. Well quite frankly I would win because of my hiiguy camera strap and it's well made design. I would draw first and faster while feeling comfortable af
customer_reviews.author: Emilio jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Camera Strap
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy as those I have bought before, the strap seems ok and the two clips will ensure ones camera doesn't drop, but seems a bit flimsy. Will see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice Goddard

customer_reviews.title: Very good product!
customer_reviews.text: My latest favorite wildlife combination is the Nikon D850 with the Nikon 200-500mm f/5.6 lens, a pretty heavy load. I had some long sessions planned and was looking for something that would help me with the load. After looking around I decided to try this strap. It has been a tremendous help. The camera now hangs very comfortably until I need it. For this type of shooting I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: David 2001

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I like that camera isn't bouncing around on my chest, I used to have a strap that caused that, but I wish there were more instructions on how to wear it, and add the tether.
customer_reviews.author: C. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: I now have the BlackRapid strap which has a significantly better carabiner as well as an additional carabiner lock that ...
customer_reviews.text: The strap itself is OK but the carabiner itself only lasted a month and the strap actually fell off of my camera. Luckily I was holding the camera. I now have the BlackRapid strap which has a significantly better carabiner as well as an additional carabiner lock that secures it.
customer_reviews.author: A Guy

customer_reviews.title: My cameras new best friend
customer_reviews.text: I just received my strap the other day. I was excited to give a try, so I hooked it all up to my brand new camera and went for a hike. Even though I haven’t had it for very long I can tell that this strap will be my new best friend when it comes to my photo hobby! I love the fit and the way that my camera feels secure. I love how it leaves me hands free for the walking and hiking but I can pick it up when the pictures appears. I just hope the strap keeps up with me years down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice strap, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I like the construction of this strap and the ease it lets you carry your camera while keeping it accessible. My only complaint is the little zipper pocket on the strap is pretty small. It's hard to get the spare camera battery in and out.
customer_reviews.author: John K Mayotte

customer_reviews.title: Love this item!!! Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this product today and I love it! Great quality and will work perfectly for me. After reading different reviews on several types of these I am glad that I chose this one. I am going to go purchase a second one right now for my video camera as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Functional and practical
customer_reviews.text: This camera strap has been wonderful to use. I prefer it more compared to the ttaditional strap. Great purchase. Very functional and practical
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Fischer-Buchholz

customer_reviews.title: I do like this although it’s hard to get used to feeling ...
customer_reviews.text: I do like this although it’s hard to get used to feeling your camera bounce around. It has come undone a couple of times. Thank goodness I did the safety hook with the little string. Because that could have potential he ruined my camera by dropping to the floor, I’m doing a two star
customer_reviews.author: ShopaholicGirl

customer_reviews.title: It's the perfect fit though
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to use the tether strap. It does have a tendency to come lose from the bottom, but you should have no problems if you use the tether strap. It's the perfect fit though, and super comfortable camera strap. It was exactly what I was hoping for at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: McKenzie L.

customer_reviews.title: allows quick access and easy point n shoot!
customer_reviews.text: I have been frustrated with normal camera strap. It can get in the way when you rotate the camera for a shoot and it is uncomfortable hanging around your neck or over the shoulder. this camera strap solves all those problems...I wish I had bought a long time ago. I hike a lot and works with my backpack and hiking itself....awesome!
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera strap
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of the neck strap my Canon came with. I was looking for something easier to handle mainly at football games. i haven't used this out but it's super easy to use and i was walked around the house a few times the camera doesn't move from your side much at all. I'm 5'3" and the camera falls right at my hip, easy to adjust the strap to make it smaller or larger. Excited to use it out.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: We went on a safari and did not want to carry my camera on a flimsy strap in fron. This strap is strong and sturdy and the safety teather is great. It was very easy to get my camera with telephoto lens up to take pictures
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Works Really Well
customer_reviews.text: Works really well - used it for two long days at airshows and it really helps to keep the strain of my 6lb V.Long lens and camera combo off my neck and onto my shoulder. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Strap
customer_reviews.text: The strap works well and is of good quality. The only issue I have is the screw from the strap which is screwed into the camera comes unwound easily. You have to continue to watch that it has not come unwound from the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great non slip backing on the shoulder, able to hold a medium format camera with larger lens securely. I always use the safety strap, still. Fits easily around smaller and larger folks.
customer_reviews.author: Susan A

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for on the go when you need to be hands free. I photograph concerts and this by far is the best addition I've gotten as far as convenience and quality
customer_reviews.author: Nicole P.

customer_reviews.title: Do not let the image fool you. If you ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not let the image fool you. If you are over 5'10", the camera is going to hang under your armpit and not to the waist line. Even then, you must be of small stature to even come close .
customer_reviews.author: H. J. King

customer_reviews.title: TRASH! Keep searching!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute TRASH! Worked well during two sessions (maybe 4 hours total) and the clip no longer clips. It's like the spring mechanism just disappeared and if I didnt have my hand on my camera it would have hit the ground and been destroyed. Will not purchase from this seller again!
customer_reviews.author: Ebony

customer_reviews.title: WELL MADE CAMERA STRAP!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and the price was right. I felt I got my money's worth the first time I used it! Having you hands free is wonderful, and having the camera at the ready even when you're moving around is fantastic! Very well made too.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Phil Allen

customer_reviews.title: Well Built and Great Strap
customer_reviews.text: This strap is exactly what i wanted and needed for my sporting event photography. I feel confident my camera is safe with this strap and its build quality.
customer_reviews.author: G. Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Security
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to find a strap that would be comfortable and not let my camera swing back and forth as I walk. It is very stiff right now and I hope it will soften with time.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma817

customer_reviews.title: Quality strap
customer_reviews.text: This strap is as good or better than similar straps I have checked out in stores and at a fraction of the cost. It seems to screw into the tripod socket very securely and it comes with a safety strap in case the screw should somehow come loose. So far, I am very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Aviel

customer_reviews.title: Look no further. This is the one.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic strap. Exactly what I was looking for. I waited to post a review until I had 100 mountain hiking miles on this strap. It works great, keeps my camera secure all day on the trail, but available at a moment's notice so I don't miss a shot. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner in photography. I recently took a photography class and was introduced to this strap. It has been a life changer! Now when we go on walks I'm not worried about my camera falling forward if I have to help my son on his bike. My camera sticks right by my side.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Easily unwinds out of bottom of camera
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a great strap (comfortable, little pocket for extra memory card, nice way the camera hangs on your body) but the screw that connects to the camera easily unwinds itself. Good thing I always have one hand on my camera and don't trust the strap as I would have dropped my camera several times in a 10 day trip...:( I have had a better one before that never unwound. Looking for that model now.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Paxhia

customer_reviews.title: A must have.
customer_reviews.text: This strap is so much better than the tiny one that came with my Nikon D7200. The length is perfect and the screw mount with the safety strap lets you know you camera and lens are safe. The little pocket on the strap is the perfect size for a spare battery or anything similar in size. It seems to be very well built and is a great purchase for anyone looking to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: B. Muscari

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This HiiGuy strap allows me to stay in the field longer when using heavy lens for wildlife photography. Better than having a six pound setup hanging from your neck. In my first field trial I found that, rather than having the camera swinging with each step, it stayed right on my left hip allowing me to get the camera up to my eye faster. I recommend it for wildlife, landscape and travel photography.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L Yates

customer_reviews.title: This thing is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My 6d with a 70-200 mm balances perfectly in the horizontal position when using a ring mount. Just get it. Forget short straps and go with this thing. It’s the last strap you’ll own.
customer_reviews.author: RenaissanceMan

customer_reviews.title: What an excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have seen many different camera straps and slings but this product is by far the best and easy to use. A must buy for your camera !!!
customer_reviews.author: Quintin Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I used this strap 4 times, and the "metal" clamp that connects the strap to the camera snapped. This made the camera strap completely useless. I know it's not an expensive strap, but should have lasted more than 4 uses. I'd recommend looking at something different.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J Gross

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy strap
customer_reviews.text: Great strap. It hangs comfortably. The pocket for the extra memory card came in handy on my trip to India. My only complaint is that the cushion part of the strap moves as you use your camera. I constantly had to adjust the strap so that the padding was on my shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super strap
customer_reviews.text: I love this, I’m so paranoid about dropping my camera, so this strap is a great security blanket for me💕
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality, super easy to put on.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the material. It doesn't feel cheap. I'm 5'2" and have a large bust so this can fit anyone. Super fast to clip on and super easy to remove. This has helped me when shooting weddings and other sessions. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Eliana

customer_reviews.title: 90 days and kaput
customer_reviews.text: Stitching that secures the screw lock to the strap came undone within a few gigs’ time. Perhaps ok for occasional use but certainly not pro level
customer_reviews.author: DL Agatep

customer_reviews.title: Overall this product does the job
customer_reviews.text: The quick release carabiner is a on the cheap side and does not instill confidence. Could have been better. What I mean is if they made the pocket on the strap 1/4 inch longer it would have been able to hold your ID,CC.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline S.

customer_reviews.title: Snaps are worthless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this strap because my daughter had one. Apparently they have changed the design slightly and the snaps do not stay closed on mine which I find really annoying. I didn't send it back because I kept hoping I would get used to it so here I am still searching for the perfect strap.
customer_reviews.author: Della Wilcox

product_meta.title: HiiGuy Camera Strap, Adjustable Padded Sling for All SLR and DSLR Cameras, Neck and Shoulder Strap, 32 Inches Long, with Screw Mount, Safety Tether
feature_bullets: More for Your Money: You get a premium quick-release camera strap... plus a durable screw mount, optional safety tether, microfiber lens cloth, memory card case & more. All at 1 sensible price

Safely Supports Any SLR Camera: With its stronger stainless-steel screw mount, your rugged HiiGuy camera sling securely holds any equipment – from a small digital camera to a professional zoom-lens model
Comfortably Fits All Photographers (Even Tall Ones): This adjustable camera neck strap measures a full 32 inches long, so you enjoy maximum range of motion. Just lift your camera & shoot

Easier on Your Shoulder: Thanks to ultralight padding, this comfortable camera strap feels like it's barely there. Textured surface keeps it snugly in place. Zippered pocket holds batteries or SD case

Complete Satisfaction: Comes with an eBook packed with practical tips for your finest-ever photography. Backed by our Lifetime Warranty. Compatible with any DSLR Camera with a standard 1/4"" tripod stud screw, including Canon EOS Rebel T6i T6s T5i T4i T3i T3 T2i T1i XT XTi XSi SL1, Nikon D7100 D7000 D5200 D5100 D5000 D3300 D3200 D3100 D3000 D90 D80

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,203 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
